intro: Centaurea brachyptera, commonly known as the short-winged centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom from summer to autumn. Centaurea brachyptera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, well-drained conditions.
